questions.question: 5. A SCR is triggered using a gate current. After sometime the gate signal is stopped. What is the status of SCR?

answers.c: SCR continues to conduct if anode current is maintained above latching current.
answers.d: SCR continues to conduct if anode current is maintained above holding current.

questions.question: 6. Reliable method for firing an SCR is?
7. In practice, the correct method of turning-ON a SCR is?

answers.a: Increasing the anode-to-cathode voltage (vAK ) till it reaches a value equal to or above forward breakover voltage (vBO ).
answers.b: The anode-to-cathode voltage (vAK ) is maintained below the breakover voltage (vBO ) and a positive voltage between the gate and cathode (Vg ) is applied across SCR.
answers.c: Increasing the anode-to-cathode voltage (vAK ) till the anode current (iA) reaches above holding current (IH ).
answers.d: Positive anode-to-cathode voltage (vAK ) automatically turns- ON the SCR.

questions.question: 8. How can a conducting SCR be turned-OFF?

answers.a: By application of negative anode current (iA) or negative anode-to-cathode voltage (vAK).
answers.b: By application of negative gate current (Ig).
answers.c: By reducing the gate current (Ig) to zero.
answers.d: All of the above methods are correct.
